reviewText: My wife adores this movie, and I have been waiting for it to come to DVD for a long time. This was a made-for-TV movie, and all we had was a VHS tape lifted from HBO 25+ years ago. The production of the DVD is very good, and the price is fair.
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of my all time favorite movies. When it came out on DVD I had to have it . If you enjoy Victorian settings, houses and clothing this one offers it all as well as being a sweet love story with comedy thrown in as well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had not seen this movie in many years....used to have it recorded on a VHS....but always wanted to see it again....Sharon Gless & Richard Thomas star as the couple....RT just a worker for her Father..but anyway..It shows love finds a way, if two people want it bad enough..excellent movie!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Liked this version much better than the original with Charles Laughton.  Richard Thomas plays a very believable and likable character as the eager to please but definitely browbeaten shoemaker to the domineering daughter of the shopkeeper, played by Sharon Gless,  who decides to take matters and the business into her own very capable hands. Its a delightful story that will have you applauding her resourcefulness and the transformation of Thomas as a shy, naive shoemaker to one who will eventually command the respect from the entire family.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 1954 version is so much better, with Charles Laughton, Brenda De Banzie and John Mills, the timing is impeccable, providing numerous laughter  opportunities
